string.text: Artifact booking
Barkeep needs to get a %s for one very wealthy client.
I just got an order from one of my regular customers... I need to get an expensive artifact for him. I think you will get it.
Excellent. Then I need to get %s. You bring one of these, you get your share.
Job's done, here is the fee!
Clear the bandit's camp
Augustus asked you to clear the bandit's camp.
Always the same merda. These barbarians are getting on my nerves. Iron them out, them and their mentulae.
well done, I'm satisfied. Rome never fell, remember that.
Bring some vodka
Augustus asked to bring him a bottle of vodka.
Drinking something would be nice. Please, go fetch me some vodka.
Drinking something wouldn't hurt. Go get some vodka, please.
Well, thank you; that's for you.
Clear the bandit's encampment
Bandits have recently become very threatening to Barkeep's business. You have to eliminate them.
Bandits have recently become very threatening to Barkeep's business. You have to eliminate them.
Well done, I'm pleased.
Mutants extermination
Once again some mutants came too close to the Bar. We need to wipe them out before they attack the checkpoint.
Once again some mutants came too close to the Bar. We need to wipe them out before they attack the checkpoint.
Not bad, here's your reward.
#FOR_SOOK
You need to collect 10 bottles for Sook.
We got a rat in here, they call him Sook. We've decided to put him on the bottle. Bring 10 bottles, please, and I will choose the best for him.
Thanks man. Bring the %s, Sook won't surely forget.
Thank you so much for helping out! I owe you one.
Kill the stalker with the tattoo
You need to kill a birdie with a S.T.A.L.K.E.R. tattoo.

Do you remember when I told you about those things my guys put down? Stalkers, who fled from their factions, said that among fighters some people were seen with tattoos on their arms. Do you understand what I'm getting at?
Well done, I'm pleased.
Clear out the bandit's camp
Bandits are getting rowdy. They need to be put in their place.
Recently, the bandits kidnapped Sidorovich's courier and killed him. You need to teach them a lesson.
Great work.
Clean up the mercenaries' camp

A few Mercs came by here yesterday... and they were some tough bastards, let me tell you. They come here and start making serious demands - "You've got one day to clear this camp out. It's gonna be our new base." Tonight they're coming back, and as you can imagine, they won't be in the mood for a chat.
The mercenaries are going to assault Rookie's Village. It is necessary to deal with this threat.
Good job.
I need a job. Got anything?
Trapper
Here's what I've got.
Find the Jellyfish artifact
A person from the big land ordered a Jellyfish from me. It's a cushy job and it doesn't pay much, but you'll promptly complete it. Come on, do it!
I don't think I'll take it.
I'll take it.
I'm here for the job.
The job is done... and here is the fee!
Bring the customer what has been promised to him.
Find the Stone Flower artifact
Find the Stone Flower artifact, which forms in the Springboard anomaly. It should net me a nice payout.
There is a job for a Stone Flower. From jewelers, by the way, so let's not upset beautiful ladies, huh? You'll get it - I've got a fee and a bottle, to drink to their health ...
Find the Night Star artifact
Find the Night Star, a rare and expensive artifact.

There's one thing... a bit unpleasant. It seems that the military-they are trying to develop a new load-bearing system. So an order for a Night star showed up, a rare artifact too, which can lighten any kind of weight... So you'll do it? Pay's good!...
Find the Meat Chunk artifact
Find the Meat Chunk artifact, which provides protection from chemical anomalies.

There is an order for an artifact, you need one that protects against chemical agents, called Meat Chunk! Our customers have some kind of laboratory. If you'll get it - you'll get some money yourself and you'll help people.
Find the Jellyfish artifact, which forms in the Springboard anomaly.
I don't find these jobs appealing at all.
Return for a reward
Bring the customer what you promised him
Bring the jaw of the bloodsucker
Tooth of bloodsucker attracts good luck? Let's see if the bloodsucker gets lucky

I heard a superstition that the tooth of a bloodsucker brings good luck. As if the one who wears that tooth around his neck gets past the anomalies, and artifacts fall right into his hands. Anyway, it's all bullshit, but there are some dopes who believe it all and are ready to pay well for it. If you bring the jaw of a bloodsucker I'll pay you well.
Bring a pseudodog's tail
Bring a pseudodog's tail

Winter's coming soon. And what do chicks like to wear there on the Big Land during winter? That's right - furs. So now there's a new fashion going around, making various accessories from the tails of pseudodogs. It's some sort of special fur! Bottom line, there's an order for such a tail. Will you take it?
Kill the bandit leader

You have to kill the leader of a group of bandits who crossed one of our traders. Most likely, he won't be alone, but with protection... Job's complicated, but it also pays adequately. Look for him in the Dark Valley.

You'll have to finish off this one dandy, one of the Bandit leaders. The other day the Bandits, by his order, intercepted my courier and shook him up and I don't waste words with those who touch my people... In a word, if you get it done, I'll return the favor. So are you up for it?
Kill the stalker-huckster
Killing a stalker... Yeah, not the best job of all - raising a hand on one of your peers. However, the payout is good, and maybe this is important?

I'm having a confrontation with this one trader. Well, if he doesn't want to cooperate, the hell with him! But I won't let anyone start filthy rumors. In short, he needs to be wasted so the others don't get out of hand. Let them all know who's the boss here...
Kill the rookie stalker
Kill the rookie stalker, who might not be a rookie at all... Who's he, then? Who cares, screw him! Most importantly, this job's pretty easy.
There's this one guy here loafing about, pretending to be a rookie, but he's rather weird... So anyway, if he suddenly disappears, you'll be doing me a great favor. You know what I mean?
Kill the Stalker called Fiend
Eliminate one of the trading competitors of Sidorovich - a stalker nicknamed Fiend.

The Fiend, aka Oleg Gusarov, used to serve in Spetsnaz. As long as he minded his own business, I had nothing against him, a Loner is a Loner. But I hear he's mustering a gang to crush down the Cordon and take control over smuggling operations from the Zone. Now this is a major problem and it has to be solved quick. So will you do it?
Kill Father Diodor
Kill a man preaching in the Zone against the mining and trading of artefacts? That's right.

I always said business and religion can't go together, they can never cross, and should never ever meddle in the other's affairs. It's just this padre, Lord forgive me, Diodor... well... he just can't see this simple truth. He keeps raving about artifact hunting, says that trading in them drives people to sin not just in the Zone, but in the whole world, on and on along those lines. Get this, he preaches the destruction of artifacts altogether! See what he is up to? The worst bit is that he's actually got some converts! I've tried to approach this Diodor this way and other, but he just keeps at it. Here's the deal: you're going to send him upstairs where he can preach all he likes... you get the point, right? And I'll give you a cool artifact. So, we've got a deal?
Kill the "sales representative"
Kill the "sales representative". Sidorovich cares about his own reputation

Imagine this: there's some weirdo running around here who introduces himself as my sales representative, uses my reputation, and then tries to hand off second-rate stuff! Broken barrels, the armor that's falling apart, expired canned goods. I've already had to deal with a few unhappy clients. Bottom line, I need a man to have a little chat with that "sales representative", whatever it takes.
Kill the target.
Find the Meat Chunk artifact
Find the Meat Chunk artifact, which provides protection from chemical anomalies.

Some scientists have stopped by, left an order for a Meat Chunk. You know, they have a certain interest in this artifact, due to its notable chemical protection. Anyway… You gonna do it? It's up to you.
Find the Crystal Thorn artifact
Find the Crystal thorn artifact, which helps the carrier get rid of radiation.

A "crone"?.. No, that's not it. "Crystal corn"?.. No, wrong again… Bugger! "Crystal Thorn", that's it! So here's the deal: I have an order for this artifact, "Crystal Thorn". Have you heard of it? They say that if you've got one, it will help your body get rid of radiation. So what do you say?
Find the Night Star artifact
Find the Night Star artifact - to help the military's scientists.

I need the Night Star artifact. I'm sorry to say it doesn't grant any wishes, been there, done that, but it can make you wealthy. Scientists pay a lot for it. They say they make some military things out of it... So, are you up for it?
Find the artifact Flash
Find the artifact Flash
The assignment is simple and the pay is good. You have to find the artifact Flash. Don't even ask who ordered it and why. Well, will you do it?
Find the artifact Goldfish
Find the artifact Goldfish

My man, you know the story about the fairytale about the Goldfish? Yeah, yeah, that's the one. There are a bunch of jokes about it too. So anyway, there's this old man who keeps on wanting to catch it. Bottom line, I need the one-of-a-kind artifact called Goldfish, the client is from the outside, respectable. Will you help out?
Kill the soldier
I must finish off an unknown serviceman. This job seems to be pretty simple... it's strange that this is an order for a person in uniform, and the customer is clearly very angry.
I need you to take down this grunt… don't ask me who he is, what do I care! Just do it. So? Can I entrust you with it?
Kill the stalker
Kill one of the stalkers. Death to the deceiver - such is the revenge of the trader.

You know, there's this type of men that you could never say a bad word about… you trust him as you trust yourself, right? You bank on him… But suddenly you find out that he is the vilest and meanest son of a bitch… So here's the deal: there's this one case that needs to get sorted. Do it, and I'll take care of the rest.
Kill a stalker from the Monolith faction
Find a former friend of Barkeep and help him die.

I used to have a friend... unbelievable, right? Eh... we came here, in the Zone, a few months after it all started, when there was nothing here. We used to do everything together... Yes, we were young, and reckless... But it was never enough for him. He wanted to leave, reach the Zone's heart; he wanted to drag me with him, and I refused - I'm grateful that I did refuse... We did a great job back then, and then he left. After all this time, people tell me they saw him there... it now stands together with the Monolith. So here you are, brother... As a man I ask you - find him, and... you know, do it so that he won't suffer; after all, I suppose... He was like a brother to me, you know?
Kill the stalker called Vampire
Find and kill a Stalker known as Vampire.

That's it, I've had enough of this scumbag! I mean Vampire; do you know him? That bastard! Sucking luck out of people instead of blood. Whoever goes with him, they all die, all to a man, but he always comes back safe and sound! Done it five times now! That's evil, don't you think? I'd love to put some flowers on this Vampire's grave… So, do you take the job?
Kill the stalker called Sparrow
Find Sparrow and avenge the death of another stalker.

Damn musketeers! Playing D'Artagnan, arseholes! As if surfing around anomalies and bowing to bullets is not enough, the oafs have now taken to fighting duels! Get this: there was this row... no one can even remember any more what started it. So these two dumbheads decided to shed some blood. And there you go, one dropped dead... a fine stalker he was, too! And the other one, Sparrow, beetled off, because I'd be the first one to put a bullet in his head. Find him. I'm sure he's still in the Zone. Will you do it?
Obtain a flesh's eye
Obtain a flesh's eye

Soon we're having a party, there'll be a fancy dinner, and certain local gourmets who are in especially high spirits (we don't need to point fingers) will definitively want to try my special recipe - eyes of "flesh" under a pork sauce. That is, in its own juices under mayonnaise. Basically, I need the eye of that beast, and quickly.
Bring the hoof of a boar
Bring the hoof of a boar

Do you know that we prepare horns and hooves? This is a big rarity. They make great jewelery from the local mutated hooves - I know a jeweler, he's interested. So go on ahead, find the boar's hoof, and there'll be cash in your pocket.
Neutralize the bandit
Neutralize a bandit called Poker.

Subject's nickname - Poker. One of the most cruel bandits' leader, swine and rapist... Evidently his head is not okay: they say he caught a rare disease in the Zone. Now he suffers quite frequent lapses of memory, and when he gains consciousness, he can't remember who and where he is. Nevertheless, he's always armed and very aggressive. Presumable location: Dark Valley. Ready for the task?
Bring the Fireball artifact
Bring the Fireball artifact to the scientists for researches

We've managed to recreate an artifact in laboratory conditions! This is a breakthrough! Now all the world will hear about our success. And the Nobel Prize will be close at hand! This is the unique artifact - "Pellicle", it's main quality is to protect from the chemical burns. Do you want me to give it to you on behalf of science? However, I do have one request - in return I need the artifact "Fireball", do you know about such? Unique thermal qualities of its surface require thorough research.
Find the "Gravi" artifact
Bring the "Gravi" artifact to the hands of the scientists.

We've approached closely to the comprehension of the nature of gravitation, practically, soon enough we'll be able to create a new generation of engines on the antigravity basis, and quite probably the path to the stars will open to us. For that, we need a Gravi artifact, and fast.
Find the Jellyfish artifact
The scientists need the Jellyfish artifact to carry out researches in the field of space-time.

Our research team is on the brink of discovering the mystery of space-time. The possibility of teleportation is no longer fantasy! The Vortex is an anomaly which squeezes space rather than just gravitationally affecting objects, as believe some of my ossified opponents-theorists, who sit in the warm research facility earnestly chewing chalk. Their glasses will fog up when they find out what results science can achieve when you work in the field! Please get me the Jellyfish artifact.
Find the Moonlight artifact
Provide a Moonlight to the scientists at Yantar. A good artifact...

We desperately need materials for continuing our research in the field of energetics. You see, we learned to generate energy with the help of artifacts. Granted, this works while the KPD isn't high enough. We were able to get the best results with the artifact Moonlight. Please bring us a sample for experiments.
Find the artifact called Sea Urchin
The scientists need the Sea Urchin artifact to improve their suits.

You are probably aware of the fact that our suits provide the best defense against radiation. The secret lies in the fact that we saturate them with a lotion made out of quite a rare artifact. To manufacture another series of these suits we need such an artifact. You call it "Sea Urchin".
Bring a part of the snork's body
It's a piece of cake getting a fragment of a snork in these parts.

We got acquainted with Semenov back in the university where I was giving lectures on genetics, and he was my student. Thus I became his scientific chief. Back then, we were only slightly unveiling the curtain of mystery of genome modification. So what was I saying? Oh, right. For genetic experiments we will need the samples of fresh cells of the muscular tissue of snork. You will have to search the bogs for this genic material. There is a hypothesis that snorks as species are the new level of human's evolution. In order to know this for sure, DNA test must be procured!
Bring the eye of a flesh
I'd better keep my body away from these eggheads just in case! Very well, I'll get them a flesh's eye, and they can do all they want with their volunteers.

Good news, young man: we have a very interesting assignment for you! I think as an intellectual being with quite a bit of experience you will be able to appreciate my colleagues' theories. The thing is, our research revealed: the eyes of the creatures called flesh in the common language, are equipped with... are you following me?... with olfactory receptors! Thus, they can not only see with their eyes, but smell with them as well! We're getting ready for an operation on transplanting this miraculous eye to one of ... one of our voluntary assistants. I believe we're about to start a craze! By the way, would you like to become a recipient of this rather amazing organ?
Bring the leg of a boar
Gourmet thrill-seekers... Alright, I'll get them some ham.

Welcome, eh... traveler! I'm so glad you dropped by: we are in need of a man to take part in a highly important experiment. My colleague Brenter wants to try and cook a meal using local fauna for a practical experiment to study the influence of mutated protein on human body. For a start, we decided to try the boars. We need ham. A boar's leg, do you understand? And if you agree to do it, please select the healthiest specimen.
Find the tail of a pseudodog
Provide the scientists with a pseudodog's tail for their bizarre experiments.

Good day, colleague! We still can not unravel the mechanism observed in the pseudodog's amazing properties, so we decided to change the vector of our quest... This time we'll start from the end ... Why are you smiling? What do you ... ah, yes. I think I understand. You see, young man, we need the tail of this creature, located at the end... yes, at the end of its body. It was not about the reproductive organs of this mammal! You might have to take a walk for them the next time.
Bring the bloodsucker's jaw
What they are going to do with bloodsucker's jaw, I don't care. I care about how much they will give me for this rarity.

Oh, stalker, glad to see you! Listen… You already met bloodsuckers in your adventures, right? If not, then we want it to happen. Bring us the lower jaw of the representative of this species, with all his so to say tableware. Unfortunately, I can't disclose the details of the experiment, besides it will negatively impact the stability of your psyche. We'll be waiting.
You did a great job! Allow me to present you with your reward.
Kill Duty's security chief and try do it as quietly as possible.

It would be well for Duty's security chief to quietly disappear. And when they're in a deep mess, I'll be able to plant a few of my guys in their gang. And then, the devil can pull off any stunt... alright, I better shut up. I suggest you take care of him from a distance, without kicking up a fuss.
Kill Captain Ivantsov.
Kill Captain Ivantsov, the closest aide of the Duty leader.

It's a tough job, I'm warning you right away, but it's worth it. Ivantsov, a close aide of the Duty leader, has been asking for it. He does the dirtiest jobs: punitive operations, raids... If you only knew how many of our guys he's killed off! It's high time we did away with this slimeball. So if you make up your mind to do it, I suggest you get yourself well armed.
Kill Colonel Petrenko
Kill Colonel Petrenko, one of the founders of the Duty faction.

Colonel Petrenko... I don't know if you've heard the name or met him, but it would be good for the two of you to meet. This man is one of the Duty founders and one of our worst enemies. Try to make sure your conversation ends as fast as possible... for him. Can you handle that?
Destroy the neutral stalker
Find and destroy the neutral stalker.
There's a fellow who's walking around not far from here. He shot one of ours down once. And something like that can't be forgiven. Will you take the job? We'll pay, don't worry.
Kill one of the Duty commanders
Kill one of the Duty commanders.
I'll pay for the head of any Duty leader! Knock one off and come back for reward.
Kill the stalker called Scarecrow
Eliminate the stalker called Scarecrow.

We eliminate monsters, except for us it's a matter of survival, not profit. Mutant populations are not as numerous; besides, they're living beings too, so we can't permit their annihilation. Some individuals refuse to understand it. An apt illustration is the stalker called Scarecrow. He got his nickname for a reason, selling stuffed mutants. We've warned him before, but all for nothing. So can you do a good deed for mother Earth?
Kill the stalker called Barin.
Kill the stalker called Barin, chief quartermaster of the Duty faction.

A cad, bootlicker, hypocrite and coward... that's stalker Barin for you. As you can see, a man with a marvellous character, which helped him get to the top of Duty. Currently supplies the faction with supplies and foodstuff, though he takes part in raids from time to time. We need to get rid of him, especially since all the clues regarding Duty logistics lead to Barin..
Bring a boar's leg
Bring a boar's leg.
We're planning a dinner party to celebrate Bob Marley's birthday. So why don't you get us some delicious ham? The more the better! Jah will never forget you!..
Kill master stalker.
The merc should pay for the assassination of each master. The fewer masters there are, the easier it is for the mercs.

We're not interested in the fact that walking dreadnoughts might wander across the Zone: stalkers in exo-skeletons armed to the teeth. The work becomes even more dangerous and harder over this. The fewer of them there are - the better it is for us. Kill one of them - and receive your reward.
Here's a fine young man! Excellent job, here's your payment.
Poker
Deserter
Upir
Sparrow
Scarecrow
Master
